page.title: 07Administration at Adisham
page.content: Adisham comes under the jurisdiction of Canterbury City Council, and is rep- resented by a Councillor living outside whose rural area covers four villages. Some consider this jurisdiction inadequate and believe the old Rural District Council of Bridge-Blean covering only villages was more effective. Generally, however, most seem satisfied by the City Council's work. The village has its own Parish Council of seven who run purely local affairs. This considers such things as planning applications, and pass recom- mendations to Canterbury City Council, who can overrule its suggestions. The Parish Council also deals with any local problems affecting the village and the hamlets. There is a Village Hall Committee which runs the Village Hall and Recreation Ground. Each Club also has its own organising Committee.
